comments.body: Powdered Snow is meant to add functionality to Leather boots so that they're not obsolete. You're missing that entire point honestly.
looks like this will be added because I think it's very interesting!
Valleys shouldn't be filled with water, but a valley with a river would be nice.
1)there are water sources that come from the mountains in to the river when river next to a mountain
i love then idea of flowing water actually being implemented as a generation change.  maybe the waterlogged caves could be exposed sometimes and create water falls
Like azalea trees spawn over lush caves, then?
Good it would be a use for that structure.
Additionally, there should be a vertical shaft of water source blocks connecting the Desert Well with the Aquifer beneath it.
Hopefully in the texture it has a little calcite and smooth basalt too. Cannot forget the chain on the lantern texture.
yeah, maybe by placing powdered snow under the lava symbolizing the cold underground
This is actually a great suggestion
I like it. It's modestly clever. :)
There is only one situation where why not works in Minecraft, and that's achievements/advancements :)
true! i think lava destroys the atmosphere of the lush caves (btw it also destroys the vegetation when generating) so it's a bit weird

The End could definitely use a bit more flair. The Nether, back before 1.16, was at least a way to travel quickly, but this dimension has only really offered us shulker boxes and elytra. Ironically, there isn't much "adventure" to be had in the dimension that was added in the adventure update.
I would love to see an end update! Maybe 1.19 as 1.17 is being split into two parts?
Good idea.
Me parece que ya existen los fósiles hechos de bloques de hueso y mineral de carbón.
413361250831 Sí lo son. Estoy sugiriendo que se agreguen fósiles más grandes para agregar algo más de maravilla al subsuelo.
This should have a pillager outpost counterpart.
Yes with the iceologer (yes I know they said they won’t add him in 1.17 but no one said that they can’t add him in 1.17.1)
This would be great, but I want the swamp and jungle villages too. They already made the textures.
Or maybe they could spawn in the mountain grottos.

The reason why villages currently can't spawn in Minecraft is that the villagers can't pathfind very well on the cliffs. It would be cool though if they add something like the open-air mineshafts that are little bridges supported by wood pillars so the villagers can traverse the terrain.
Then maybe they could have a mountain-peak village with bridges that would be cool

I think to craft Bundles you still need 6 Rabbit Hide, and to craft 1 Rabbit Hide you need 4 Bat Hide. This way you don't interfere with the effort needed to obtain Bundles.

Regarding to use Bat Wings [rare drop] it's not that simple to find a new potion you can brew into, because there are already so much of them

Idea for the bat potion:

Echolocation:

Allows you to see the glowing outline of mobs up to a certain range, even through walls.
The level of the potion determines how far you can see them.

If you combine bat meat with a bowl and a carrot and eat it, you have a small chance to get an effect called Covid that gives you a greater urge to go outside, you can turn other villagers to zombie villagers, you lose half a heart every minute until you die, and also you can't wear a helmet

Even if it is only bat hides which can also be used to craft bundles, I think this is a good idea to add some drops to bats. The biggest complaint I've seen about bundles (and it makes sense) is how few biomes you can find rabbits in. But you can always find a cave with bats, and they are similarly difficult to chase and kill as rabbits. A lot of people have pointed out that bundles don't seem useful and I've seen Mojang point out it's goal is to be useful in the early game, but if your early game has no deserts nearby (or the other, rarer biomes), then it's only a benefit during the early game sometimes on specific seeds. Bats are everywhere (underground) and therefore with some effort it is always possible to get bundles during the early game if a player wants to.

I can't describe how perfect and fitting this sounds (hehe, sounds). I have always thought that one way or another people are just going to kill the Warden as soon as the cave are updated. With deep dark bats, it will be significantly harder and more complicated to explore a deep dark cave without dying. I also realize that bats use vibrations to navigate their surroundings, similar to the Warden itself.

Perhaps these bats and the Warden share a relationship of some kind. Maybe food has something to do with it. Maybe protection. But then again, I feel like the Warden is a lonely and miserable being, and that a relationship would make it less lonely.
They could have 14 hp and drop fangs or wings for some kind of potion. Maybe they'll even have a mouth similar to the warden.
They should be bigger too, dealing 6 damage (3 hearts) with poison included. And maybe they eat normal bats and silverfish (and other bugs).
These bats should be unable to trigger skulk sensors.

I would like fog also as a block.

or just different visibility ranges dependent on biomes.

i really miss the black fog and particles just above the bedrock layer. it was so ominous :)
It should be the block used in them abandoned underground shelters and the midway point between the grimstone and normal stone
I like this idea. it would certainly add a darker feel to caves. I think I could use it with stone bricks and grimstone bricks if it were added.

Or they could use it for the normal version of grimstone and make what we are seeing now be the cobble. The "new" texture here really is jarring and looks more like a cobblestone texture than a stone texture. I don't want to get rid of the new texture since it would be nice for building but it really looks bad in vast quantities right now.
Yes!!! I hope they add this too, i LOVED the "glumstone" texture.

Grimstone and Glumstone blending/transition. It would be like grass as if it were changing colour depending on what biome you are next to. Thinking about this blending idea now sounds not to be that great, because unless they were separate blocks, you could only use one variant of colour depending on where you are, but in turn it would maybe give the deep dark a bit more variation:
Original (Glumstone), Darker Glumstone, Grey Glumstone, Grimstone, Darker Grimstone, Lighter Grimstone, Lighter Glumstone.
That actually makes sense and it should spawn in like y = 0 to y = -12

I agree! Although, a mossy Grimstone brick block would be another great addition. Not only would these be great for builders but it’d be another way for players to add light to a cave deep down if they happen to run out of another resource (like torches) while adventuring.

I think we should consider if stone could be made into a cobble stone, why can't blacks tone and grimstone be also made into a cobbleblackstone and cobblegrimstone. Then it would be different a and the glow would seem to be veiny like the trucks of the nether trees look veiny. Maybe also have a slight animation?
but if frogs spawn in swamp instead of lush caves that would be realistic.
We already have frogs now.
I actually like this sound idea waaaay better.
Having a dog could also help players find hidden dig sites, which should exist.
Eyo! I originally commented this same idea on the Twitter thread. I think it would be such a cool way to get players to tentatively dig up a ruin and to give dogs a bit more personality.
Dogs could sniff out and bark at sus blocks like sus sand.
Yup, yup, terrifying yup.
Or could be an advancement too, although they are both the same.
Maybe the name of the achievement should be "Fe, fi, fo, fum!" because the warden is kind of like a giant.
I like the idea, but I was thinking more along the lines of them being enemies you defeat and in doing so you gain certain special items.
I know I had miss typed some things I am sorry
GameBOX, don't worry about spelling and grammar errors, you should see other posts. But if you need to, click on the gear sign at the top of your post to edit it
Perhaps it could be another use for the lightning rod. I think redstone would be unneccessarry in this case.
Okay but a new golem is something we should have do you guys agree
But the copper golem should have a weak spot on the back it would look like exposed gears and pulleys so that if people spam them on pvp servers it's still possible to win
Okay i like that idea i mean how many types of golems can minecraft have. Well they need more and think they need this golem!!!
this would be great why has this not been looked into

This would be an amazing cave variant that I'd love to see 

 

 

 

(I know Minecraft has no waves but then again, nothing in Minecraft makes sense. What happens to the other oak planks in stairs? WHAT?)
It is true that Minecraft has no waves and I added that information to show how they are created in real life.
